channel.title: Tech on Anaminus.Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Tech on Anaminus.Blog

item.title: Biometrics
item.content:encoded: Fingerprint scanning is literally leaving your password, which you can never change, on everything you have ever touched, or will ever touch. And don’t forget about all those pictures that incidentally contain your fingers in immaculate detail.

item.title: Install
item.content:encoded: You can tell that a microsoft product is involved when the install process takes 200 times longer than it should.

item.title: NFTs
item.content:encoded:
An NFT is a string of bytes. Some authority invented out of thin air then makes the unenforceable claim that these bytes are associated with something else in a vain attempt to give them value. After that it’s just the usual trading of fake items in a fake market with fake money.

Given that the value of these items hinge completely on this authority anyway, the blockchain part (and all the dumb shit that goes with it) can be skipped entirely. This is how Roblox works.

The real point of interest is whether the fake money can be exchanged for real money. In Roblox’s case, the fake money earned from the sales of fake items cannot be exchanged for real money. However, it can be used indirectly towards earning “clean” money that can be exchanged.

item.title: Search engines
item.content:encoded: The current state of search engines: I do a search for “firefox import profile” and the top result is a health website titled “Import Browser Settings Firefox Cancer”. Next result is a cooking website titled “Import Firefox Settings Best Recipes”.

item.title: Linux support
item.content:encoded:
Game developer supports Linux, receives more higher quality, non-platform-specific bug reports.

https://www.reddit.com/r/gamedev/comments/qeqn3b/despite_having_just_58_sales_over_38_of_bug/

item.title: ID verification
item.content:encoded: Giving away your soul has never been easier.
